name: Diane

topics.topic_text: So, about the alliance with Caesar's Legion....
topics.response_text: Don't worry, Jack and I have talked it over. We'll talk up the idea of breaking the alliance.

topics.topic_text: I'm looking to make a few caps. Got any work for me?
topics.response_text: I don't have any compelling reason to trust you, given your behavior. So no, I'm not really inclined to give you a job.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Get away from me, you lunatic!

topics.topic_text: Have you started making meds yet?
topics.response_text: Yeah, you made a pretty good argument. We'll keep it small for now, but if it turns a profit we might expand.

topics.topic_text: What do you have for sale?
topics.response_text: Jack handles the small-time purchases. You should talk to him unless you're looking for a major shipment.

topics.topic_text: What do you think about Caesar?
topics.response_text: Well, it's not like I'm super-attached to working with Caesar or anything, but if it'll stop his patrols from harassing my runners, I'm all for it.

topics.topic_text: What is it you do here?
topics.response_text: We keep the Great Khans from falling apart, essentially. Jack manufactures the chems, I organize the runners and the shipments.

topics.topic_text: Tell me a little about the Great Khans.
topics.response_text: I'll spare you the history lesson - talk to Papa Khan if you want to hear that story.

topics.topic_text: Caesar isn't going to let you run drugs as an ally any more than he supports it now. He hates chems.
topics.response_text: I haven't heard anything like that. Do you have any proof?

topics.topic_text: Not yet, but I'll find some.
topics.response_text: Okay, come on back when you do.

topics.topic_text: No, and finding some would be too much work. Never mind.
topics.response_text: Okay, I won't bother.

topics.topic_text: VMS46NullLinks
topics.response_text: We've got an associate in the Crimson Caravan Trading Company who distributes for us in Outer Vegas. He's been after us for a new shipment.

topics.topic_text: Sure, just tell me who I'm looking for and where to start.
topics.response_text: About three weeks ago I sent Anders southeast to find a route into Arizona to open new markets for our product.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like more trouble than it's worth. I'll pass.
topics.response_text: Okay then. Job'll be waiting if you change your mind.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll be back as soon as I have any news.
topics.response_text: Thanks. Prove you're reliable on this, and I'll have more for you later.

topics.topic_text: Sure, what have you got?
topics.response_text: With Anders out of commission for so long, we're shorthanded on runners, and some backlogs have piled up.

topics.topic_text: Sure, I'll do it.
topics.response_text: Great. Here's the package - your contact is Don Hostetler at the Crimson Caravan. Come back and see me when you're done.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll do that.
topics.response_text: Anything else?

topics.topic_text: Piece of cake.
topics.response_text: Don't get cocky, the Fiends are twitchy. Most of them won't bother a Khan, but the ones outside the Vault... well, they're outside for a reason.

topics.topic_text: Medical supplies are always scarce, and they don't kill the buyer as often. Think of the profits!
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] You've got a point. Selling meds to the locals could be a pretty nice side gig. All right, I'll tell Jack to give it a try.

topics.topic_text: I'll take the caps.
topics.response_text: Here you go, you've earned these.

topics.topic_text: I'll take the recipe.
topics.response_text: Here you go. Enjoy it.

topics.topic_text: What alliance?
topics.response_text: Papa Khan has been talking to Caesar's emissary for weeks now - they're always going on about crushing the NCR.

topics.topic_text: Why are things so tough?
topics.response_text: Red Rock Canyon isn't exactly the most hospitable place - there's no food, barely any water, and nothing anybody wants.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Sure, what do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: So you're drug dealers?
topics.response_text: We're supplying things people want in exchange for things our tribe needs. Don't judge us.

topics.topic_text: Who do you sell to?
topics.response_text: We make regular shipments to a lot of settlements around the Mojave - a lot of our business comes from the Fiends lately.

topics.topic_text: Good to know. I had some other questions.
topics.response_text: Like what?

topics.topic_text: Not yet, but I had more questions.
topics.response_text: Okay, but please find him as soon as you can.

topics.topic_text: I'm afraid he's dead.
topics.response_text: What? How? What happened?

topics.topic_text: <Truth> I killed him.
topics.response_text: What? Why the hell would you do that? Are you insane?

topics.topic_text: <Lie> The Legion caught him and crucified him. He was dead when I found him.
topics.response_text: Dammit! Okay, well, thank you for finding out at least. Was there something else you needed?

topics.topic_text: I didn't know he worked for you.
topics.response_text: Oh, because that makes it so much better! Get out of my sight, I have nothing to say to you any more!

topics.topic_text: It was fun. He made a noise like a deflating balloon.
topics.response_text: You're psychotic! Get out of my sight, I have nothing to say to you any more!

description:
Diane is a 30 year-old Human Female.

Diane is a cunning and ambitious Great Khan who serves as an adviser to Papa Khan. She manages the drug trafficking operation that supplies the Great Khans with chems, working closely with her childhood friend Jack, who produces the drugs in the Red Rock Canyon lab.

Diane's Personality: Diane is sharp-witted, pragmatic, and fiercely loyal to the Great Khans. She's a savvy businesswoman who isn't afraid to get her hands dirty to protect her interests and those of her people. While she maintains a tough exterior, she cares deeply for Jack and their shared history.

Diane's Backstory: Diane was born into the Great Khans tribe and grew up alongside Jack. From a young age, she showed a natural aptitude for organization and negotiation, while Jack was more interested in chemistry and creating substances. When the Great Khans were forced to leave their original territory and settle in the Mojave, Diane saw an opportunity to strengthen their position by establishing a drug trade. She convinced Jack to use his knowledge to produce chems, and together they built a lucrative operation that now supplies the entire tribe. Their close bond has made them an effective team, with Jack being fiercely protective of Diane, who in turn manages the business aspects of their enterprise.
